name: Partition Deed
shortDescription: A partition is a division of a property held jointly by several persons, so that each person gets a share allotted to him.
description: A partition is a division of a property held jointly by several persons, so that each person gets a share allotted to him. A partition deed is mostly used by families or coparcenary, to divide members’ shares in inherited properties.

howWeWork.heading: How to get a Partition Deed Agreement drafted

content.title: Schedule Call with the Lawyer
content.description: Schedule Call and discuss with the Lawyer your Document drafting requirements

content.title: Get your Agreement Draft
content.description: Lawyer will deliver customized draft of the Document as per your requirement

content.title: Dedicated Lawyer Available
content.description: 60 Minutes of Talk time with the Lawyer for discussing requirements and changes in the draft

content.title: First Draft within 3 Days
content.description: First draft of the Document will be delivered within a maximum of 3 working days

content.title: Finalize Document
content.description: 2/3 Iterations per Document allowed to incorporate your suggestions/changes

content.title: Details of parties
content.description: The partition deed outlines the details of the parties involved. It bears the name, age and addresses of the parties involved in the transaction.

content.title: Details of the property
content.description: The details of the property are written in the deed. the details include plot area, identification number, details of construction, the exact location and surroundings of the property. The schedule of details is attached to the deed.

content.title: Terms of partition
content.description: The deed prescribes the matter in which the partition is to take place. It outlines the share of each party involved in the property.

content.title: Registration
content.description: The deed prescribes the manner in which the partition deed is to be registered. It also specifies the schedule to be attached with the partition deed.

content.title: Mutual consent of parties
content.description: When all co-owners mutually agree to have the property divided, they can execute the partition deed.  the partition deed ensures the division of the property according to the share of the individual.

content.title: Inheritance laws
content.description: The deed prescribes the laws and regulations applicable to the property. Different inheritance laws are applicable to different properties.
Partition deed ensures that each party receives their share in a lawful manner without any dispute.
After executing the partition deed the parties can sell, gift, let out or mortgage their share.

faqs.question: Is it compulsory to register a partition deed?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is compulsory to register a partition deed. it is also necessary to pay the stamp duty as applicable.

faqs.question: Is partition deed a title document?
faqs.answer: A registered partition deed is considered to be a title document.

faqs.question: What is the difference between partition deed and settlement deed?
faqs.answer: A partition deed requires mandatory stamping and registration while a settlement deed does not require stamping and registration.

faqs.question: I have a partition deed; how can I get it reviewed by a Lawyer?
faqs.answer: ezyLegal can help you get your partition deed reviewed and provide you with the right legal guidance. You can upload your document and schedule your Consultation with an ezyLegal Lawyer.

faqs.question: What is the process of getting the Agreement drafted from ezyLegal?
faqs.answer: ezyLegal offers Standard and Customized Document drafts. If you chose the customized Document option, your call will be scheduled with a Lawyer to whom you can explain your specific requirements. The first draft will be delivered within 2 working days and then you would be allowed 2-3 iterations to make changes in the draft.

faqs.question: How will the Document be delivered to me?
faqs.answer:
The Document when ready will be available on the ezyLegal website (www.ezylegal.in) in your secured Account. You will be notified on email and WhatsApp whenever a new version of the Document is uploaded. You can Log-in and View or Download the document.  
Copy of the documents delivered by ezyLegal will always be available in your ezyLegal account forever.
